intro: Hedeoma villosa, commonly known as hairy hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive pungent odor, while the flowers are small and white or pale green. Hedeoma villosa is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
